    LemniscateSine
    Lemniscate Sine: sl(z)=∫(1/(1-t^4),t=0..z)
    sl(x) = q(1,x)/q(3,x)
    where
    q(k,x) = theta[k](G*x;exp(-x))
    and
    G = M(1,√2) = Gauss's constant
    where M(a,b) is the arithmetic-geometric-mean of 1 and the √2
    RealComplexFunction<R extends RealFunction>
     
    RiemannZetaFunction
     
    RiemannZetaFunctionTest
     
    SelfAdjointFunction
    A self-adjoint function (more commonly called a Hermitian function which is named after Charles Hermite) is a complex function with the property that its complex conjugate is equal to the original function with the variable changed in sign:
    f^*(x)=f(-x) where f^* is the complex conjugate of f
    ∀x in the domain of f.
    SFunction
    The rational meromorphic quartic S(t)=tanh(ln(1-t^2)))=((1 - t^2)^2 - 1)/((1 - t^2)^2 + 1)
